articles.author: James Mackenzie, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israeli airstrikes had killed two successors to Hezbollah's slain leader.
articles.title: Hezbollah targets Israeli troops on Lebanese border, sirens in Beirut

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian overnight and early morning attacks on Ukraine hit civilian and critical infrastructure facilities, injuring at least seven people across the country, authorities said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russia hits civilian, critical infrastructure, injures eight in Ukraine

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Leonara LaPeter Anton
articles.description: Hurricane Milton marched across central Florida on Thursday after making landfall on the state's west coast hours earlier, whipping up deadly tornadoes, destroying homes and knocking out power to nearly 2 million customers.
articles.title: Hurricane Milton weakens as it marches across central Florida, homes destroyed

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr pressed Southeast Asian leaders and China at a regional summit on Thursday to urgently speed up negotiations on a code of conduct for the South China Sea, while accusing Beijing of harassment and intimidation
articles.title: Philippines calls for urgency from China, ASEAN in negotiating South China Sea code

articles.author: Jason Lange, Bo Erickson
articles.description: Harris leads Trump among voters in the vast middle of American society by 47% to 41%.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris overtakes Trump among suburban voters, Reuters/Ipsos polling shows

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: The ASEAN bloc remains a "stabilising force" in Southeast Asia despite making only incremental progress on key issues, including Myanmar's civil war and the drafting of a code of conduct for the South China Sea, its secretary-general said.
articles.title: ASEAN plays 'stabilising' role on regional tensions, secretary-general says
EU's von der Leyen to visit Moldova in show of support ahead of referendum

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China has no right to represent Taiwan, but the island is willing to work with Beijing to combat challenges like climate change, Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said on Thursday, striking both a firm and a conciliatory tone, drawing anger from China.
articles.title: China cannot represent Taiwan and should work with Taipei on global challenges, Lai says

articles.author: Nellie Peyton
articles.description: Vote counting was under way in Mozambique on Thursday after a peaceful national election that is widely expected to see the ruling Frelimo party extend its 49 years in power.
articles.title: Mozambique early vote counting under way after peaceful election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India approved on Wednesday plans to construct two of a new class of nuclear-powered attack submarines, two defence officials said, in a project estimated to cost about 450 billion rupees ($5.4 billion).
articles.title: India prepares to build two nuclear-powered attack submarines
